Dettenhausen was first officially mentioned in the Codex Hirsaugiensis in around 1100 BC as "Detenhusen".
Dettenhausen has 5.421 citizens (as of June 30, 2008). 
Dettenhausen's coat of arms is a red deer against a yellow background with a yellow ear of grains against a red background.

Dettenhausen is ideally located to go hiking, swimming, eat great food and visit the Schönbuchmuseum, the local museum with exhibits about stone cutting, forestry and hunting.

Dettenhausen has a very active sister city program with two cities, one in the former East of Germany,
